Reviews.Title: Excellent Deal! Spacebar key fix here!
Reviews.Author: harley mclain
Reviews.Content: Ok, First off... I have a quick fix for the space bar!Take the small barcode sticker off the sleeve that the machine is packed in, cut it into a few tiny squares and stack them 3 high. Carefully pull the spacebar key off. The keys pop off, be careful though. Now do you see the small, round rubber button? Stick the sticker you made onto the corresponding area underneath where it would contact the space key. Press the key back on and it now works perfectly.The problem is that there is a design flaw in that they left too much space between the key and the rubber sensor under it. I realized this when I noticed no springback after depressing the spacebar. I'm typing this review now and I can type as fast as any laptop, and press anywhere on the key and get a space.Oh yeah, this laptop rules... $249.00 at Best Buy. I love it! So light and thing, sleek looking. Best deal I've seen for the money in a long time.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for an economy laptop.  4hr battery life, hdmi, vga, 2usb 2.0, 1 usb 3.0, 4GB ram, 300GB disc
Reviews.Author: Work In Progress
Reviews.Content: Nice little laptop with a fairly peppy CPU.  This should be an adequate laptop for the average user, with the exception of anyone who would want a CD/DVD drive.  If you only intermittently use DVD's or CD's, you might consider buying an external USB DVD drive (read only drives start at about $25-30).  Omitting the optical drive slims down the unit considerably.  It has 2 USB 2.0 ports and 1 USB 3.0 (useful if you have ultra-fast flash drives for transferring data).  For video output it has 1 hdmi and 1 vga port.  It also comes with an SD card slot (I think this may be a "universal" slot for multiple types, but I don't want to say for certain).  As already stated by several people, this has a very mediocre keyboard, especially the spacebar.  Take a look at the fix that user Harley has posted with my comment on how to disassemble/reassemble the spacebar with a shim to fix the problem fairly easily.  If you aren't very mechanical or have problems handling tiny parts, you might want to get someone to do this for you.  Battery life appears to be something around 4 hours or less, which while not great is also not bad either, just average.  There is NO removable battery as far as I can tell, so don't count on swapping out the battery when you run low.  If you are an inveterate road-warrior this might be a consideration.  Other than the Windows 8 (which I don't like much), which is hardly the fault of the machine, everything runs fine.  One last issue.  There is a very large trackpad which tends to be an unintentional palm-reader, i.e. the flat of your hand can sometimes call up commands unintentionally.  While I've seen this issue with other laptops, this one is especially vulnerable to this fault, so don't be too surprised when the screen suddenly changes on you while you're typing.  Just be aware of your hand position and don't rest it on the flat area in front of the keys.  Yes, I know this is annoying, but it's not a game changer.One thing you might want to change right out of the box.  The default setting for Windows Update is "automatic".  You should immediately change it to "...choose updates to install".  What will happen if you don't is that it starts to download 360MB of updates when it first connects to the internet.  Many people are complaining of "lock ups", which in all likelihood is Windows update consuming all the download speed (your browser will take forever to load a page while this is happening).  Your best bet is to wait until you have a reasonably fast connection before manually going to Windows Update and selecting all the updates it is requesting to download.  Then be prepared to walk away and have dinner while it downloads updates (assuming you have a 2MBit/sec connection like I do).  You may have to reboot at least once to complete.  Once you get past this the network performance will rise dramatically and pages will load as normal.  This is a bit of a gotcha if you don't know what's happening.  ASUS should either have the latest updates pre-loaded before they ship, or give a warning so you have a chance to download when it is convenient, rather than starting out with a giant lump-o-data download, which makes their laptop seem like a lemon (when it in fact is quite fast).

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Norman Dietsch
Reviews.Content: I gave the first one I purchased to my daughter, that is, after using it for a few days.  Bought this  one to replace the one given.  It is just what I need for the price.  It lives up to its advertising.  Like Asus.  When I had a glitch in another Asus earlier their service techs were helpful, courteous and prompt on the phone.  When the tech could not walk me through the glitch he advised sending it in under the warranty.  I sent the machine (not this one) to ASUS.  They worked out the fault and now all is great.  That is why I purchased two more ASUS products.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT LAPTOP!
Reviews.Author: James G. Janossy
Reviews.Content: I teach college and "invest" in low-end laptops so I'm prepared with personal experience to answer questions from my students on various machines. I bought an Asus X502C and am using it right now, it is a very good system and has a real advantage in being very thin and light. It seems like an "ultrabook" model but in plastic, not metal--but still seems durable. With two core Intel chip and 1.5 GHz speed it keeps up with everything I am trying on it which includes mostly word processing, creating and reading .pdf documents, internet uploads and downloads, YouTube. This is a gorgeous machine for the price and entirely functional for student and home use. Should travel well in a suitable case, I would not suggest banging it around by itself in a backpack. Battery is not changeable, and battery life looks like only a few hours. Note that it doesn't have a CD/DVD drive, those are getting to be rather obsolete for software installs since most software installs are downloads now, but if you plan on watching movies on DVDs be aware that you can't on this system (subscribe to an online video service instead?).

Reviews.Title: nice laptop
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: the laptop works well, and has very good performance, all that I want to the university.... the big screen , the trackpad all of this laptop is good

Reviews.Title: Good Deal
Reviews.Author: Danny K
Reviews.Content: Pros:Large 15" Bright screen, large touch pad, large, Asus instant on turns the laptop on in  seconds. Windows 8 , HDMI slotCons:Keyboard needs time to get use to. Very flat keys. SD Card slot is stupid, it will not hold the entire card, only half so you can't leave it in the laptop .(otherwise I would of given it 5 stars)Comments:With windows 8 you need a start button, download classic shell and you will have one! I don't know what Microsoft was thinking!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for the money!
Reviews.Author: DPFA
Reviews.Content: I know the reviews might have mixed feelings, but this laptop is between $250-350 dollars. What do you expect?I used this for notes in college, very portable and user friendly. It won't be made like a 1500 Apple Macbook Pro..because it's not meant to be.I just wanted to do a "normal expectations" review for those who know what to expect.I never had any issues with keys, battery life, screen, or Windows 8. Maybe I got a good one, but it's been pretty dependable and well made.Pros:Full size keys, good size screen and resolution, full HDMI port, ethernet, sd card slot, very thin/lightCons: if I had to list one I guess I agree with some reviews about fingerprints...but seriously who comments about fingerprints? It's like taking a white glove to your floorboards...who has time worry about such trivial things.If you want a pretty good laptop for cheap, without getting an old netbook, a tiny screen, or a used computer...this can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic buy!
Reviews.Author: CristinaT
Reviews.Content: This laptop works like a charm! Honestly, my only two complaints are that the sound kind of acts funny sometimes, as in sometimes when I plug in my headphones, it takes a little bit for it to register the headphones and send the sound through them instead of the computer speakers. My other complaint is that the finish of this laptop allows it to get dirty pretty fast (fingerprints, etc), but that's really it. I'm very happy with this and Asus is a great brand. My sister got a Dell laptop not long before me and had problems with it from the get-go. So I'm glad I went with Asus!

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy!! Beware!!
Reviews.Author: rock n. rolla lll "rocknrolla"
Reviews.Content: Very disgusted with this company. I will NEVER, EVER purchase another product from this company--EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!I had to return 2 computers within a few weeks due to manufactures defect and to make matters worse, I was told by ASUS representative to return the 2nd computer to Best Buy (where I purchased). Best buy told me they wouldn't send it back to ASUS to be serviced, that it was my responsibility. I was also told by another of ASUS reps that i would be refunded for shipping costs. NOW, I am on hold being told another story (yet again) from ASUS rep. that I will NOT be reimbursed the $20.00 for shipping. This company has THE WORSE CUSTOMER SERVICE and exports their calling centers to poorly trained reps. You will be given courteous service but uninformed, inflexible, unhelpful, and simply poor customer service. The product is flimsy and you won't even be getting your 300 dollar worth of product. The first computer I had, the screen went blank within 3 days. The second: the W, R, and SHIFT keys stopped working. Stay away!!

Reviews.Title: Peice of crap
Reviews.Author: Tilak Pael
Reviews.Content: It cant even run full hd youtube! It is a very terrible laptop, it slow, cant even search something without it stalling. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: researched and bout this for my brother
Reviews.Author: Jacques gates
Reviews.Content: was looking for a decent computer for a reasonable price since its only used for school work and watching videos this comp has plenty of power do do that. although for abit more i would upgrade and go with the asus ultrabook.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Nat
Reviews.Content: Awesome computer, hard to work at first but once you get the hang of the navigation it's easier. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Unless it's on sale don't buy it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was under the impression Asus made quality laptops so when I saw this one on sale I decided to buy it. It's slow, the screen isn't that great and it's pretty flimsy.

Reviews.Title: WiFi
Reviews.Author: Michael Husby
Reviews.Content: Does not have great wifi reception.  Laptop is extremely light.. Not a fan of Windows 8 which runs the laptop.

Reviews.Title: All the ad said it would be
Reviews.Author: Linda Somero
Reviews.Content: It met my expectations and my grandson is very happy with it.  He looks forward to start 2014 with his new laptop.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop, but some have defective spacebar
Reviews.Author: Amazonian "over the top"
Reviews.Content: some of these have had bad spacebar problems... I haven't seen anyone publish a fix, other than send it back, which is what I did.  If the spacebar works you are in good shape.  If it doesn't it's a big hassle.  It's almost like the spacebar gets compressed or stuck in shipping.

Reviews.Title: ASUS 15" laptop
Reviews.Author: Jonathan W. Shirley
Reviews.Content: Earlier this year I bought three ASUS laptops of varying models, one for my office, one for my elderly mother for email and one for my daughter.  We had major hassles with all three. The main problem on each one was activation of Windows.  Two were windows 7 and one windows 8, and on each we eventually ended up working for several hours (over 5) with a level 2 Microsoft Technician to get them to work. As I recall, there was a defective "security stack" that would not permit the computer to activate.  Could not load printers, and every boot up was a Groundhog Day with the validation process. My mother eventually returned the one to me because she became frustrated with it; and Microsoft charged me $100 for a tech support call because they said it was "corrupted".  So, buyer beware.Other than that, I hate the touch pad.  It is off center to the screen, so if you are accustomed to lining up your hands with the screen, you will always click the right click when you intend to click the left click.  They all had swipe features, which were a MAJOR pain in the behind. I disabled all of them.  Finally, for some reason, the wireless on them is very slow.  I checked online and this appears to be common.  Just slow internet connection. Don't  know what the problem is.I have thrown in the towel on Microsoft.  If Apple ever develops a decent compatible word processing and spreadsheet software, I will dump every PC in my firm and go with Apple.
